title: Task-Based Syntactic Complexity Enhancement Program for Second Language Writing Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic grammar knowledge and simple sentence construction skills
context.additional_context: Enhanced Second Language Writing Skills Course for Mathematics Professionals. Operated with real-time interaction and formative assessment in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can utilize appropriate syntactic structures for descriptive, argumentative, and narrative task types with 80% accuracy aligned to CEFR A1-C2 levels
Learners can increase mean length of clause (MLC) measured by NLP-based analysis tools by 1.5 words or more
Learners can produce specific syntactic elements (non-third-person singular verbs, relative clauses, interrogative clauses) with over 70% accuracy depending on task types
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
